translated: I praise and extol this Dharma with great emphasis in order to generate great joy in beings, so that they may attain benefit and happiness for a long time, and in order to make them weary, to pacify them, and to bring them to complete understanding.

original: blo gros mtha' yas /
analyzed: blo gros mtha' yas /
translated: “O Anantamati!

original: yang khyod kyis chos 'di 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i bde ba sbyin par byed pa yin yang srid pa rnams su dbul phongs pa sna tshogs snang bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: yang khyod kyis chos 'di 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i bde ba sbyin par byed pa yin yang srid pa rnams su dbul phongs pa sna tshogs snang bar gyur pa ni /
translated: You should also know that although this Dharma bestows the happiness of both mundane and supramundane excellence, the various forms of poverty and destitution appear in existence.

original: sems can rnams chos zab mo 'di las rab tu nyams par gyur pa'i phyir 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'byor pa dang bde ba rnams spangs pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams chos zab mo 'di las rab tu nyams par gyur pa'i phyir 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'byor pa dang bde ba rnams spangs pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Because sentient beings are greatly lacking in this profound Dharma, they are to be seen as having abandoned mundane and supramundane excellence, prosperity, and happiness.

original: blo gros mtha' yas /
analyzed: blo gros mtha' yas /
translated: “O Apramāṇāyaṣaḥ,

original: yang khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du bzhugs pas chos rin po che zab mo 'di 'byor ba du ma rnyed sla bar gyur to //
analyzed: yang khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du bzhugs pas chos rin po che zab mo 'di 'byor ba du ma rnyed sla bar gyur to //
translated: you should consider that, with the Tathāgata present in person, it is easy to acquire this profound jewel of the Dharma and its manifold benefits.

original: snyam du blta bar bya @165b zhing; khyod kyis chos zab mo 'di la nan tan gyis rab tu bsgrub par bya'o //🔽byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni /
analyzed: snyam du blta bar bya @165b zhing; khyod kyis chos zab mo 'di la nan tan gyis rab tu bsgrub par bya'o // byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni /
translated: You should practice this profound Dharma with perseverance.🔽“O Apramāṇāyaṣaḥ,

original: ngas chos rin po che 'di yang dag par bstan pa na thos par yang mi 'dod na /
analyzed: ngas chos rin po che 'di yang dag par bstan pa na thos par yang mi 'dod na /
translated: when I teach this jewel of the Dharma, childish ordinary beings do not even want to listen to it.

original: len pa dang / 'dzin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: len pa dang / 'dzin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention their taking it up and upholding it?

original: de bzhi gshegs pa mngon sum du bzhugs shing chos rin po che 'byor pa'i dus su yang mnyan par mos pa dang / 'bri bar yang 'dun par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhi gshegs pa mngon sum du bzhugs shing chos rin po che 'byor pa'i dus su yang mnyan par mos pa dang / 'bri bar yang 'dun par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If they do not wish to listen to the Dharma and do not wish to write it down even when the Tathāgata is present in person and the precious Dharma is flourishing,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus lnga brgya tha ma la yang dag par chos rab tu rnam par 'jig pa'i tshe sangs rgyas dang / chos dkon mchog dang / chos 'dzin par byed pa rnam pa gsum mngon du mi 'gyur ba'i dus su mnyan pa dang / 'bri bar mos par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus lnga brgya tha ma la yang dag par chos rab tu rnam par 'jig pa'i tshe sangs rgyas dang / chos dkon mchog dang / chos 'dzin par byed pa rnam pa gsum mngon du mi 'gyur ba'i dus su mnyan pa dang / 'bri bar mos par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could they wish to listen to and write it down in the future, in the final five hundred years when the perfect Dharma is completely destroyed and the Buddha, the precious Dharma, and the three who uphold the Dharma are no longer present?

original: blo gros mtha' yas /
analyzed: blo gros mtha' yas /
translated: “O Aprameya­mati!

original: 'on kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na gal te de bzhin gshegs pas legs par byin gyis brlabs par gyur na /
analyzed: 'on kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na gal te de bzhin gshegs pas legs par byin gyis brlabs par gyur na /
translated: However, in the future, if the Tathāgata’s blessings are received,

original: chos rin po che zab mo 'di rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos rin po che zab mo 'di rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: this profound precious Dharma will be obtained.

original: blo gros mtha' yas /🔽shin tu 'jigs pa'i dus de'i tshe chos rin po che zab mo 'di yang dag par nyams shing 'grib pa'am /
analyzed: blo gros mtha' yas / shin tu 'jigs pa'i dus de'i tshe chos rin po che zab mo 'di yang dag par nyams shing 'grib pa'am /
translated: O Aprameya­mati!

original: zad par gyur pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: zad par gyur pa med mod kyi /
translated: In that extremely frightening time, this profound precious Dharma will not be completely lost, diminished, or exhausted.

original: 'on kyang chos 'di la nyan pa dang / 'dzin par byed pa med de /🔽nga'i spyan sngar sems rtse gcig tu mnyan par mos pa dang / go cha chen po bgos pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos 'di la nyan pa dang / 'dzin par byed pa med de / nga'i spyan sngar sems rtse gcig tu mnyan par mos pa dang / go cha chen po bgos pa ni /
translated: However, there is no one who listens to or upholds this Dharma.

original: ma gtogs te /
analyzed: ma gtogs te /
translated: Except for those who are focused on listening in front of me and who have donned the great armor,🔽none of them will be able to listen to this Dharma.

original: de dag de'i tshe chos 'di la rab tu dga' bas nyan pa dang / len par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de dag de'i tshe chos 'di la rab tu dga' bas nyan pa dang / len par 'gyur bas so //
translated: At that time, those who listen to this Dharma with joy will be able to uphold it.

original: @166a *// de'i tshe sems can gang chos 'di thos nas rab tu dang ba tsam skyed par byed na yang ngas de dag chos rgya chen po 'di mngon par sgrub par 'gyur bar bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: @166a *// de'i tshe sems can gang chos 'di thos nas rab tu dang ba tsam skyed par byed na yang ngas de dag chos rgya chen po 'di mngon par sgrub par 'gyur bar bstan pa yin na /
translated: At that time, if any sentient beings who hear this Dharma give rise to just a little faith, I will teach them to accomplish this vast Dharma.

original: da ltar chos 'di la yongs su dang ba bskyed nas nan tan gyis sgrub par byed pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: da ltar chos 'di la yongs su dang ba bskyed nas nan tan gyis sgrub par byed pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If that is the case, what need is there to mention those who give rise to complete faith in this Dharma and practice it diligently?

original: blo gros mtha' yas /
analyzed: blo gros mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantamati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings

original: bla na med pa'i go cha dang / go cha chen po tshad med pa rnams yang dag par bgos pa na 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i go cha dang / go cha chen po tshad med pa rnams yang dag par bgos pa na 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: don the unsurpassed armor and the immeasurable great armor, they think as follows.

original: bdag ni / sems can dbul phongs par gyur ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bdag ni / sems can dbul phongs par gyur ba 'di lta ste /
translated: I will remove the poverty of sentient beings, namely:🔽poverty of morality, poverty of learning, poverty of wisdom, poverty of liberation, and poverty of the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: tshul khrims kyis rgud pa dang / thos pas rgud pa dang / shes rab kyis rgud pa dang / rnam par grol bas rgud pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas rgud pa de dag thams cad la chos chen po 'dis phongs pa med par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis rgud pa dang / thos pas rgud pa dang / shes rab kyis rgud pa dang / rnam par grol bas rgud pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas rgud pa de dag thams cad la chos chen po 'dis phongs pa med par bya'o //
translated: I will remove their poverty by this great Dharma.

original: chos chen po 'dis phongs pa med par bya ba'i phyir rgud pa thams cad spangs nas tshul khrims kyi nor dang / thos pa'i nor dang / shes rab kyi nor dang / rnam par grol ba'i nor dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i nor gyis phyug par bya'o //
analyzed: chos chen po 'dis phongs pa med par bya ba'i phyir rgud pa thams cad spangs nas tshul khrims kyi nor dang / thos pa'i nor dang / shes rab kyi nor dang / rnam par grol ba'i nor dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i nor gyis phyug par bya'o //
translated: Having removed all poverty by this great Dharma, I will enrich them with the wealth of morality, the wealth of learning, the wealth of wisdom, the wealth of liberation, and the wealth of the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi me rnams rab tu zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi me rnams rab tu zhi bar bya'o //
translated: I will extinguish the fires of passion, hatred, and delusion.

original: nad thams cad las sos par bya'o //
analyzed: nad thams cad las sos par bya'o //
translated: I will cure them of all diseases.

original: bla na med pa'i sman gya nom pa gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i sman gya nom pa gtang bar bya'o //
translated: I will give them the most excellent medicine.

original: sman 'di'i dbang @166b gis nad rnam pa sna tshogs bsal nas bde ba chen po thob par bya'o //
analyzed: sman 'di'i dbang @166b gis nad rnam pa sna tshogs bsal nas bde ba chen po thob par bya'o //
translated: By the power of this medicine, I will eliminate all kinds of illnesses and bring about great happiness.

original: lhag ma dang bcas pa gtan du spangs te shin tu bsil ba'i ngo bo nyid bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byas nas yid la sems pa dang / so sor rtog pa'i lhag ma gcig kyang lus pa med pa dang /
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas pa gtan du spangs te shin tu bsil ba'i ngo bo nyid bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byas nas yid la sems pa dang / so sor rtog pa'i lhag ma gcig kyang lus pa med pa dang /
translated: I will manifest the unsurpassed nirvāṇa, which is the utterly cool nature that is the complete relinquishment of all that is conditioned, and I will establish them in the absence of even a trace of mental activity and discernment,

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas thams cad yongs su tshol ba med pa la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas thams cad yongs su tshol ba med pa la dgod par bya'o //
translated: and in the absence of any search for anything conditioned or unconditioned.

original: snyam mo // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: snyam mo // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni /
translated: Because this nirvāṇa

original: mchog tu bde zhing yongs su tshol ba thams cad lus pa med pa'i phyir dang / yongs su tshol ba gtan du zhi zhing yongs su zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu bde zhing yongs su tshol ba thams cad lus pa med pa'i phyir dang / yongs su tshol ba gtan du zhi zhing yongs su zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is the supreme bliss, since it is the absence of all search, and it is the complete pacification and exhaustion of all search.

original: blo gros mtha' yas /
analyzed: blo gros mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantamati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas

original: go cha chen po de lta bu bgos nas gzhan yang sems can thams cad la snying brtse bas yongs su bsdu ba'i phyir theg pa chen po la zhon nas 'di snyam du /
analyzed: go cha chen po de lta bu bgos nas gzhan yang sems can thams cad la snying brtse bas yongs su bsdu ba'i phyir theg pa chen po la zhon nas 'di snyam du /
translated: Having donned such great armor, he further mounts the Great Vehicle out of compassion for all sentient beings.🔽He thinks,

original: theg pa chen po 'di la ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'di la ni /
translated: “In this Great Vehicle,

original: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang chibs nas nges par byung par gyur to //🔽ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang 'di la chibs nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang chibs nas nges par byung par gyur to // ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang 'di la chibs nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the buddhas of the past have gone forth.🔽The buddhas of the future will also go forth in it.

original: da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang 'di la chibs nas nges par 'byung bar gyur kyang gshegs par gyur pa yang med la /
analyzed: da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang 'di la chibs nas nges par 'byung bar gyur kyang gshegs par gyur pa yang med la /
translated: The buddhas of the present are going forth in it.

original: chibs pa dang / nges par 'byung ba yang med do snyam mo //
analyzed: chibs pa dang / nges par 'byung ba yang med do snyam mo //
translated: But there is no going, no mounting, and no going forth.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med @167a *//
analyzed: stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med @167a *//
translated: Because of emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness,

original: pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / byed pa med pa'i phyir nges par 'byung bar gyur pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / byed pa med pa'i phyir nges par 'byung bar gyur pa yang ma yin /
translated: non-arising, and non-action, there is no going forth.

original: nges par 'byung ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba yang ma yin /
translated: It is not a definite emergence,

original: nges par 'byung par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it a definite emergence to come.

original: theg pa 'di la zhon nas de ltar nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: theg pa 'di la zhon nas de ltar nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who, having mounted this vehicle, attain definite emergence in this way,

original: legs par 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: legs par 'byung ba yin te /
translated: they are the ones who emerge well.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pas chos thams cad dang 'dus pa yang ma yin /🔽'dus pa med pa yang ma yin pas 'ong ba med pa /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pas chos thams cad dang 'dus pa yang ma yin / 'dus pa med pa yang ma yin pas 'ong ba med pa /
translated: Since they are without attachment, they are neither united with nor separated from any phenomena.

original: 'gro ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa yin no //
translated: Since they are neither united with nor separated from anything, they are non-coming and non-going.

original: theg pa 'di lam gang gis nges par 'byung ba'i tshe yang 'dus pa ma yin pas 'ong ba med pa /
analyzed: theg pa 'di lam gang gis nges par 'byung ba'i tshe yang 'dus pa ma yin pas 'ong ba med pa /
translated: When this vehicle definitely emerges through this path, it is also neither united with nor separated from anything.

original: 'gro ba med pa yin no //🔽theg pa 'di dang / lam 'dis go cha chen po byas nas nges par 'byung ba'i tshe yang 'dus pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa yin no // theg pa 'di dang / lam 'dis go cha chen po byas nas nges par 'byung ba'i tshe yang 'dus pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is non-coming and non-going.

original: 'dus pa med pa yang ma yin pas /🔽'ong ba med pa /
analyzed: 'dus pa med pa yang ma yin pas / 'ong ba med pa /
translated: When this vehicle and this path are donned as the great armor and attain definite emergence, they are neither united with nor separated from anything.

original: 'gro ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa yin te /
translated: They are non-coming and non-going.

original: dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are unobservable.

original: blo gros mtha' yas /
analyzed: blo gros mtha' yas /
translated: Anantamati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas

analyzed: go cha 'di dang / theg pa 'di dang / lam 'dis de ltar gzhol bar bya'o //
translated: should proceed by means of this armor, this vehicle, and this path.

original: gzhan yang go cha 'di dang / theg pa 'di dang / lam 'dis gzhol bar byed pa'i tshe 'di snyam du /
analyzed: gzhan yang go cha 'di dang / theg pa 'di dang / lam 'dis gzhol bar byed pa'i tshe 'di snyam du /
translated: Moreover, when proceeding by means of this armor, this vehicle, and this path, they should not think

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos gang yin pa dang / nyan thos kyi chos gang yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gang yin pa'i @167b chos de dag bdag dang nye ba zhig gam /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos gang yin pa dang / nyan thos kyi chos gang yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gang yin pa'i @167b chos de dag bdag dang nye ba zhig gam /
translated: that the qualities of ordinary beings, the qualities of śrāvakas, the qualities of pratyekabuddhas, and the qualities of buddhas are either near to them

original: 'on te thag ring ba zhig ces yongs su rtog par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'on te thag ring ba zhig ces yongs su rtog par mi byed do //
translated: or far away.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i chos gang yin pa de dag bdag dang nye ba zhig gam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i chos gang yin pa de dag bdag dang nye ba zhig gam /
translated: They should not think that the qualities of emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-arising, and non-conditioning are either near to them

original: 'on te thag ring ba zhig ces yongs su rtog par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'on te thag ring ba zhig ces yongs su rtog par mi byed do //
translated: or far away.

original: yongs su skye ba dang bral ba dang / 'gag par 'gyur ba nas mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bar gyi go cha de dag la yang bdag dang nye ba zhig gam /
analyzed: yongs su skye ba dang bral ba dang / 'gag par 'gyur ba nas mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bar gyi go cha de dag la yang bdag dang nye ba zhig gam /
translated: He does not think, ‘This armor, from the point of view of the great transcendence of suffering, is for me or for someone close to me,

original: 'on te thag ring ba zhig ces yongs su rtog par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'on te thag ring ba zhig ces yongs su rtog par mi byed do //
translated: or it is for someone far away.’

original: blo gros mtha' yas /
analyzed: blo gros mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantamati,

original: go cha chen po dang / theg pa 'di dang / lam 'di dag la ni /
analyzed: go cha chen po dang / theg pa 'di dang / lam 'di dag la ni /
translated: in this great armor, in this vehicle, and on this path,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / sems can thams cad gang gis kyang bskul bar mi nus pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu gzhol bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / sems can thams cad gang gis kyang bskul bar mi nus pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu gzhol bar byed do //
translated: all bodhisattvas, all hearers, all solitary buddhas, and all sentient beings are unable to incite him, and so he proceeds toward unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: blo gros mtha' yas /
analyzed: blo gros mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantamati,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: the blessed buddhas

original: go cha 'di dang / theg pa 'di dang / lam 'di la g-yo ba mi mnga' ba brnyes pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: go cha 'di dang / theg pa 'di dang / lam 'di la g-yo ba mi mnga' ba brnyes pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: have attained the absence of movement in this armor, in this vehicle, and on this path, and so they have attained complete nirvāṇa.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa'i phyir dang / chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / @168a *//
analyzed: chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa'i phyir dang / chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / @168a *//
translated: Because all phenomena are unmoving, and because the nature and characteristics of all phenomena are free from disharmony,

original: mtshan ma rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / yongs su rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / mtshan ma dag gis so sor brtag pa dang / mchog tu so sor brtag pa dang / kun tu so sor brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / yongs su rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / mtshan ma dag gis so sor brtag pa dang / mchog tu so sor brtag pa dang / kun tu so sor brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: because of the purity of characteristics, because of complete purity, and because of the absence of individual investigation, supreme investigation, and complete investigation by means of characteristics.

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis so sor brtag pa dang / mchog tu so sor brtag pa dang / kun tu so sor brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis so sor brtag pa dang / mchog tu so sor brtag pa dang / kun tu so sor brtag par bya ba ma yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rdo rje las @194b mngon par grub pa /

original: mthu bo che shin tu brtan pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthu bo che shin tu brtan pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: and will attain the great power of a firm body.

original: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed yod pa thams cad lus kyi mthu stobs gtugs te shin tu brtan pa'i sku de rnam par gzhig par 'dod na yang gang gis kyang rnam par gzhig par mi nus so //
analyzed: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed yod pa thams cad lus kyi mthu stobs gtugs te shin tu brtan pa'i sku de rnam par gzhig par 'dod na yang gang gis kyang rnam par gzhig par mi nus so //
translated: Even if all the sentient beings in the great trichiliocosm were to try to destroy that firm body with their own physical strength, no one would be able to destroy it.

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi 'khor gyi nang du chos kyi snang ba rab tu bstan na yang gang gis kyang brgal du med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi 'khor gyi nang du chos kyi snang ba rab tu bstan na yang gang gis kyang brgal du med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if one teaches the light of the Dharma in the midst of the assembly of the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, no one will be able to dispute it.

original: sems can gang gis chos zab mo 'di len tam /
analyzed: sems can gang gis chos zab mo 'di len tam /
translated: If any sentient being were to take up this profound Dharma,

original: klog gam / kha ton 'don nam /
analyzed: klog gam / kha ton 'don nam /
translated: to read it, to recite it,

original: nan tan brtson 'grus kyis sgrub par byed na /
analyzed: nan tan brtson 'grus kyis sgrub par byed na /
translated: or to practice it with earnest effort,

original: ji ltar mos pa bzhin du rigs shin tu mtho ba'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur ba nas byang chub kyi shing drung du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar du yang thob nas grags pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams khyad par 'phags shing lam tha dad pa dang 'dres pa med pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar mos pa bzhin du rigs shin tu mtho ba'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur ba nas byang chub kyi shing drung du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar du yang thob nas grags pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams khyad par 'phags shing lam tha dad pa dang 'dres pa med pa dang /
translated: In accordance with their aspirations, they will be born into a very high caste and will attain the state of a buddha in the presence of the Bodhi tree. They will have perfect fame, and their world system will be superior, without any other paths,

original: bram ze dang / mu stegs can gyi ming yang med na /
analyzed: bram ze dang / mu stegs can gyi ming yang med na /
translated: and without even the names of brahmins and tīrthikas.

original: lta ba ngan pas log par yongs su tshol ba lta smos kyang ci dgos pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi ming yang mi thos na /
analyzed: lta ba ngan pas log par yongs su tshol ba lta smos kyang ci dgos pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi ming yang mi thos na /
translated: If they do not even hear the names of nonvirtuous phenomena,

original: mi dge pa'i rtsa ba mngon par sgrub pa lta yod par ga la 'gyur ba dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa'i sor mo las 'od zer bkye nas 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa rnams snang bar byed de /
analyzed: mi dge pa'i rtsa ba mngon par sgrub pa lta yod par ga la 'gyur ba dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa'i sor mo las 'od zer bkye nas 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa rnams snang bar byed de /
translated: how could they possibly engage in the roots of nonvirtue? They will emit light rays from their fingers and toes and illuminate immeasurable world systems.

original: @195a *// sems can gang gi lus la reg pa de dag thams cad bde ba thob par byed pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @195a *// sems can gang gi lus la reg pa de dag thams cad bde ba thob par byed pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: and all those sentient beings who touch their bodies will attain happiness and will manifest unsurpassed, perfect awakening.

original: blo gros 'phags pa /
analyzed: blo gros 'phags pa /
translated: “Āryaprajñā,

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: therefore,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang de'i bstan pa lan tan sgrub par byed pa de dag ni; yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa de lta bu dag 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang de'i bstan pa lan tan sgrub par byed pa de dag ni; yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa de lta bu dag 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice the qualities taught by the Tathāgata will attain such extraordinary qualities.

original: gal te ngas yongs su rdzogs par brjod par gyur na nam yang mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ngas yongs su rdzogs par brjod par gyur na nam yang mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If I were to explain them completely, we would never come to the end.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros 'phags pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros 'phags pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Āryaprajñā,

original: blo gros 'phags pa /
analyzed: blo gros 'phags pa /
translated: “Āryaprajñā,

original: gang dag byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'di la gnas pa de dag gis ni /
analyzed: gang dag byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'di la gnas pa de dag gis ni /
translated: those who abide in this bodhisattva path

original: rnam par dag pa'i chos zab mo 'di nan tan gyis mngon par bsgrubs nas stong pa nyid dang rjes su mthun pa dang / rab tu dben pa dang rjes su mthun par gyur na /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i chos zab mo 'di nan tan gyis mngon par bsgrubs nas stong pa nyid dang rjes su mthun pa dang / rab tu dben pa dang rjes su mthun par gyur na /
translated: “If one practices this profound, pure Dharma, and if one becomes in accord with emptiness and in accord with complete seclusion,

original: chos kyi snang ba rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: then one will attain the illumination of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi snang ba'i dbang gis ni /
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba'i dbang gis ni /
translated: By the power of the illumination of the Dharma,

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid tha dad pa med pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid tha dad pa med pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one will see that all phenomena are of the same nature.

original: ngo bo nyid tha dad pa med pa mthong ba'i phyir ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid tha dad pa med pa mthong ba'i phyir ni /
translated: Because one sees that all phenomena are of the same nature,

original: lta ba rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta ba rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: one’s view will be pure.

original: lta ba rnam par dag pa'i phyir ni /
analyzed: lta ba rnam par dag pa'i phyir ni /
translated: Because one’s view is pure,

original: chos su lta ba yang med @195b do; ;chos gang yang rang bzhin dang bral bar lta ba yang med do //
analyzed: chos su lta ba yang med @195b do; ;chos gang yang rang bzhin dang bral bar lta ba yang med do //
translated: one will not have a view of phenomena, nor will one have a view of the absence of any nature of phenomena.

original: chos su lta ba rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa yang med do //
analyzed: chos su lta ba rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa yang med do //
translated: Because one’s view of phenomena is pure, there is no purity.

original: rnam par dag pa yang med pa gang yin pa de la ni; rnam par dag pa'i lus kyang med pas /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa yang med pa gang yin pa de la ni; rnam par dag pa'i lus kyang med pas /
translated: And because there is no purity, there is no pure body.

original: rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul thob nas chos kyi dbyings rnams dbyings kyang ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul thob nas chos kyi dbyings rnams dbyings kyang ma yin /
translated: Having attained the domain of pure wisdom, the dharmadhatu is neither a domain nor not a domain.🔽

original: dbyings ma yin pa yang ma yin par yang yang dag par 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyings ma yin pa yang ma yin par yang yang dag par 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having attained the domain of pure wisdom, they will attain the realm of the dharmadhātu, which is neither a realm nor not a realm.

original: dbyings su lta ba rnam par dag par gyur pas /
analyzed: dbyings su lta ba rnam par dag par gyur pas /
translated: Having purified the view of the realm,

original: dbyings rnam pa sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid du 'du shes pa yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyings rnam pa sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid du 'du shes pa yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will abandon the notion that the various aspects of the realm are real.

original: ngo bo nyid du 'du shes pa spangs pa'i phyir dbyings kyi tshul gyi gsang tshig gang yin pa rtogs par gyur nas chos rnams dbyings ma yin par yongs su shes par gyur te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du 'du shes pa spangs pa'i phyir dbyings kyi tshul gyi gsang tshig gang yin pa rtogs par gyur nas chos rnams dbyings ma yin par yongs su shes par gyur te /
translated: Having abandoned the notion of reality, they will understand the secret words of the way of the realm and know that phenomena are not the realm.

original: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings la tha dad pa med par mthong pa'i phyir dang / rnam par 'jig pa med par mthong ba'i phyir dang / 'gyur pa med par mthong ba'i phyir dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul thams cad la thabs mkhas pa rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings la tha dad pa med par mthong pa'i phyir dang / rnam par 'jig pa med par mthong ba'i phyir dang / 'gyur pa med par mthong ba'i phyir dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul thams cad la thabs mkhas pa rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they see the realm of phenomena as undifferentiated, as indestructible, and as unchanging, they attain skill in all the ways of the realm of phenomena.

original: thabs mkhas pa'i dbang gis ni /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa'i dbang gis ni /
translated: By the power of skill in means,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul yongs su shes shing /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul yongs su shes shing /
translated: they understand the way of the realm of phenomena.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis chos kyi dbyings rnams kyi bye brag gi tshul gang yin pa de dag la yang rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //🔽spyod pa 'di la gnas pa'i tshe chos thams cad la gnas pa @196a *//
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis chos kyi dbyings rnams kyi bye brag gi tshul gang yin pa de dag la yang rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro // spyod pa 'di la gnas pa'i tshe chos thams cad la gnas pa @196a *//
translated: And by the power of samādhi, they engage with the specific ways of the realms of phenomena.

original: med pa dang / mngon par zhen pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa dang / mngon par zhen pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they abide in this practice, they do not abide in or cling to any phenomena.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul thams cad ci rigs par rnam pa sna tshogs su rab tu phye nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul thams cad ci rigs par rnam pa sna tshogs su rab tu phye nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because they are not attached to anything, they can teach the entire Dharma realm in all its various aspects.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu'i dbang gis gzhan yang bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la rnam par brtson pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyis gcig las mang por bsgyur ba dang / mang po las gcig tu bsgyur ba dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu'i dbang gis gzhan yang bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la rnam par brtson pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyis gcig las mang por bsgyur ba dang / mang po las gcig tu bsgyur ba dang /
translated: “By the power of samādhi, they will also attain the miraculous powers of concentration, liberation, and samādhi. They will be able to transform one into many and many into one.

original: ri dang / brag dang / rtsig pa dag la thogs pa med par 'gro ba dang / 'phur ba la dbang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri dang / brag dang / rtsig pa dag la thogs pa med par 'gro ba dang / 'phur ba la dbang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be able to pass through mountains, cliffs, and walls without being obstructed and will attain mastery over flying.

original: khams bzhi po dag 'dus pa la rab tu mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khams bzhi po dag 'dus pa la rab tu mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be skilled in the combination of the four elements.

original: khams la mi gnas par khams thams cad rab tu shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khams la mi gnas par khams thams cad rab tu shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will know all the elements without being attached to the elements.

original: nam mkha'i khams dang gcig tu gyur kyang nam mkha'i khams la mngon par zhen pa dang / thogs pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams dang gcig tu gyur kyang nam mkha'i khams la mngon par zhen pa dang / thogs pa ci yang med do //
translated: They are not obstructed by anything.

original: khams 'dus pa la rab tu mkhas par gyur pa'i phyir khams thams cad thabs mkhas pas mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: khams 'dus pa la rab tu mkhas par gyur pa'i phyir khams thams cad thabs mkhas pas mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: Because they are skilled in the combination of the elements, they accomplish all the elements with skillful means.

original: mngon par bsgrubs pa'i phyir chu'i khams rab tu rtogs par gyur nas chu'i khams las dud pa 'thul ba dang / me rab tu 'bar ba dang / dud pa 'thul ba dang / me rab tu 'bar ba gnyis ka ston par byed pas /
analyzed: mngon par bsgrubs pa'i phyir chu'i khams rab tu rtogs par gyur nas chu'i khams las dud pa 'thul ba dang / me rab tu 'bar ba dang / dud pa 'thul ba dang / me rab tu 'bar ba gnyis ka ston par byed pas /
translated: Having realized the water element through accomplishment, they manifest the water element as smoke, as a blazing fire, and as both smoke and a blazing fire.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs @196b su ston pa'i bar du byas nas sems can rnams la phan gdags pa chen po byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs @196b su ston pa'i bar du byas nas sems can rnams la phan gdags pa chen po byed do //
translated: Having manifested various forms, they perform great service to sentient beings.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyi thabs mkhas pa la rab tu gnas nas g-yo ba med par ji ltar mos pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang du mos pa de bzhin du skye bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyi thabs mkhas pa la rab tu gnas nas g-yo ba med par ji ltar mos pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang du mos pa de bzhin du skye bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Having been established in the skillful means of the principle of the realm of phenomena, they are unmoving. They are born in whatever buddha field they aspire to, in accordance with their aspirations.

original: srid pa rnams su mngal du skye ba'i lus bzlog ste sprul pas skye ba'i lus blangs nas rtag tu phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mthong zhing de bzhin gshegs pa de dag kyang mtshan ni /🔽'di lta bu'o //
analyzed: srid pa rnams su mngal du skye ba'i lus bzlog ste sprul pas skye ba'i lus blangs nas rtag tu phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mthong zhing de bzhin gshegs pa de dag kyang mtshan ni / 'di lta bu'o //
translated: In the realms of existence, they will turn away from the body that is born from a womb and will take birth through emanation. They will always see the thus-gone ones who dwell in the worlds of the ten directions. They will know the names of those thus-gone ones,

original: rigs ni / 'di lta bu'o //🔽'khor 'dus pa ni /
analyzed: rigs ni / 'di lta bu'o // 'khor 'dus pa ni /
translated: their families,

original: 'di lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'o //
translated: the assemblies that gather around them,

original: chos ston pa ni /🔽'di lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos ston pa ni / 'di lta bu'o //
translated: the Dharma they teach,

original: zhes ma 'dres par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: zhes ma 'dres par rab tu shes so //
translated: and all of this without confusion.

original: de nas 'khor de nyid du gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpag tu med pa'i rgyal ba zhes bya ba 'dus par gyur pa des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas 'khor de nyid du gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpag tu med pa'i rgyal ba zhes bya ba 'dus par gyur pa des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then, in that assembly, the bodhisattva great being Boundless Victor, who was present in the assembly, said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos ji lta bu zhig la gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos ji lta bu zhig la gnas par gyur na /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings abide in a certain way,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du gsungs pa'i yon tan mchog de dag thob par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du gsungs pa'i yon tan mchog de dag thob par 'gyur lags /
translated: they will attain the supreme qualities as taught by the Bhagavān.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpag tu med pa'i rgyal ba la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpag tu med pa'i rgyal ba la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Aparimitāyus,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang chos thams @197a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang chos thams @197a *//
translated: “Bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are without abode in all phenomena

original: cad la gnas pa med pa gang yin pa des ngas ji skad bstan pa'i yon tan mchog tu gyur pa de dag 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cad la gnas pa med pa gang yin pa des ngas ji skad bstan pa'i yon tan mchog tu gyur pa de dag 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: will attain those supreme qualities as I have taught.”

original: dpag tu med pa'i rgyal ba /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i rgyal ba /
translated: Aparimitāyus,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams gal te gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas par gyur tam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams gal te gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas par gyur tam /
translated: if bodhisattva mahāsattvas were to abide in form, feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness,

original: gal te sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams la gnas par gyur tam /
analyzed: gal te sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams la gnas par gyur tam /
translated: or if they were to abide in the earth element, water element, fire element, wind element, or space element,

original: gal te 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams la gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams la gnas par gyur na /
translated: the form realm, or the formless realm,

original: ngas mdo sde 'di las yon tan 'di dag dang ldan par mi ston to //
analyzed: ngas mdo sde 'di las yon tan 'di dag dang ldan par mi ston to //
translated: I would not teach that they would possess these qualities.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos thams cad la gnas pa med cing /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos thams cad la gnas pa med cing /
translated: If bodhisattva great beings were to abide in all phenomena,

original: 'byung ba dang / 'jug pa med par gyur na /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang / 'jug pa med par gyur na /
translated: without arising or engaging,

original: ngas de dag gi yon tan gyi rgya mtsho chen po dpag tu med pa thob par 'gyur bar rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: ngas de dag gi yon tan gyi rgya mtsho chen po dpag tu med pa thob par 'gyur bar rab tu bstan to //
translated: I would teach that they would attain the great, immeasurable ocean of qualities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ni /🔽chos cung zad tsam yang dmigs par bya ba dang / gnas par bya ba yang med la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ni / chos cung zad tsam yang dmigs par bya ba dang / gnas par bya ba yang med la /
translated: Because for bodhisattva great beings,

original: chos cung zad tsam yang 'jug par bya ba'am /
analyzed: chos cung zad tsam yang 'jug par bya ba'am /
translated: there is not even the slightest phenomenon to be observed or to abide in,🔽and there is not even the slightest phenomenon to engage in or to disengage from.

original: 'byung bar bya ba yang med par chos rnams kyi tshul la legs par gnas shing g-yo ba med @197b pas so; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ni /🔽gnas pa dang / g-yo ba med de /🔽g-yo ba med pa'i phyir mtho ba yang med do //🔽dma' ba yang med do //
analyzed: 'byung bar bya ba yang med par chos rnams kyi tshul la legs par gnas shing g-yo ba med @197b pas so; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ni / gnas pa dang / g-yo ba med de / g-yo ba med pa'i phyir mtho ba yang med do // dma' ba yang med do //

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang bsngags pa brjod pa dang / chos kyi bkod pa'i yo byad kyis rab tu brgyan pa dang / sbyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la gnas pa dang / bzod pa rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang bsngags pa brjod pa dang / chos kyi bkod pa'i yo byad kyis rab tu brgyan pa dang / sbyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la gnas pa dang / bzod pa rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: be praised by the bhagavat buddhas, be adorned with the array of the teachings, perfect generosity, abide in pure discipline, have pure patience,

original: bla na med pa'i brtson 'grus dang / dmigs su med pa'i bsam gtan dang / shes rab chen po thob nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu gzhol bar 'gyur bas mchog tu gyur ba'i nang na rab mchog tu gyur pa dang /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i brtson 'grus dang / dmigs su med pa'i bsam gtan dang / shes rab chen po thob nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu gzhol bar 'gyur bas mchog tu gyur ba'i nang na rab mchog tu gyur pa dang /
translated: They will attain unsurpassed diligence, concentration without reference point, and great wisdom, and will thus be dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: myur du thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i ming thob nas byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: myur du thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i ming thob nas byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug par 'gyur bas /
translated: They will attain the name “omniscience,” and will thus sit at the seat of awakening.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi gdugs thogs nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gsol ba 'debs pas lha dang mi rnams la snang ba chen po byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu 'god par @212a *//
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi gdugs thogs nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gsol ba 'debs pas lha dang mi rnams la snang ba chen po byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu 'god par @212a *//
translated: The four great kings will hold up parasols and request them to turn the wheel of Dharma, and they will thus create great illumination for gods and humans and establish them in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'gyur ro // gzhan yang blo gros mtha' yas /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // gzhan yang blo gros mtha' yas /
translated: “Moreover, O Boundless Intellect,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po grang chos thams cad kyi rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin brtson 'grus kyis sgrub par byed na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po grang chos thams cad kyi rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin brtson 'grus kyis sgrub par byed na /
translated: If bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice with diligence the samādhi of the seal of the ocean of all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings dang mtshungs pa nyid du mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings dang mtshungs pa nyid du mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: they will see the sameness of the realm of phenomena of all phenomena.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i tshe chos kyi dbyings la yang chos thams cad du mi mthong la /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i tshe chos kyi dbyings la yang chos thams cad du mi mthong la /
translated: When they see in that way, they will not see the realm of phenomena in all phenomena,

original: chos rnams la yang chos kyi dbyings su mi mthong bas brtson 'grus kyis mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: chos rnams la yang chos kyi dbyings su mi mthong bas brtson 'grus kyis mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: and they will not see all phenomena in the realm of phenomena. Therefore they practice with diligence.

original: chos thams cad kyi khams 'dus pa la thabs mkhas pas chos thams cad kyi khams la yang mngon par zhen pa yang med /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi khams 'dus pa la thabs mkhas pas chos thams cad kyi khams la yang mngon par zhen pa yang med /
translated: Through skill in the gathering of the elements of all phenomena, they are not attached to the elements of all phenomena,

original: g-yo ba yang med do //
analyzed: g-yo ba yang med do //
translated: and they do not waver.

original: chos thams cad kyi khams 'dus pa la thabs mkhas shing mngon par zhen pa yang med /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi khams 'dus pa la thabs mkhas shing mngon par zhen pa yang med /
translated: Through skill in the gathering of the elements of all phenomena, they are not attached

original: rnam par rtog pa yang med pas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang med pas /
translated: and they do not conceptualize.

original: chos gcig tu 'dus pa'i nang du chos thams cad 'dus par mthong la /
analyzed: chos gcig tu 'dus pa'i nang du chos thams cad 'dus par mthong la /
translated: They see all phenomena included within a single phenomenon,

original: chos thams cad 'dus pa'i nang du chos gcig 'dus par mthong yang chos thams cad 'dus pas chos gcig 'dus pa la rten par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'dus pa'i nang du chos gcig 'dus par mthong yang chos thams cad 'dus pas chos gcig 'dus pa la rten par yang mi byed la /
translated: and they see a single phenomenon included within all phenomena. Yet, they do not rely on the inclusion of a single phenomenon by the inclusion of all phenomena,

original: chos gcig gi 'dus pas kyang chos thams cad kyi 'dus pa la rten par mi byed do //
analyzed: chos gcig gi 'dus pas kyang chos thams cad kyi 'dus pa la rten par mi byed do //
translated: and they do not rely on the inclusion of all phenomena by the inclusion of a single phenomenon.

original: chos 'di gcig rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir yang chos thams cad rab tu rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos 'di gcig rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir yang chos thams cad rab tu rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: By realizing this one phenomenon, they realize all phenomena.🔽By realizing all phenomena, they realize the basis of the knowledge of this one phenomenon. Yet, they do not rely on any phenomenon.

original: chos @212b thams cad rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir yang chos 'di gcig shes par bya ba'i gnas rnams rab tu rtogs par 'gyur yang chos rnams kyi chos thams cad la rten par mi byed do; ;nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams 'dus pa rtogs par khong du chud
analyzed: chos @212b thams cad rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir yang chos 'di gcig shes par bya ba'i gnas rnams rab tu rtogs par 'gyur yang chos rnams kyi chos thams cad la rten par mi byed do; ;nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams 'dus pa rtogs par khong du chud
translated: They understand the realization of the convergence of the appropriated aggregates.

original: pas nye bar len pa'i phung po sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid la yang 'dus pa yod pa'am /
analyzed: pas nye bar len pa'i phung po sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid la yang 'dus pa yod pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the aggregates are not the self, because they are multiple, like the aggregates of another person.🔽

original: 'dus pa med par mngon par zhen pa skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'dus pa med par mngon par zhen pa skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, they do not generate attachment to the characteristics of the various natures of the appropriated aggregates, whether they are collected or not.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de ltar spyod pa'i tshe chos gang rgyu dang rkyen mang po 'dus pa las skye ba dang / chos gang rgyu dang rkyen mang po 'dus pa las mngon par sgrub par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag kyang rtogs par khong du chud do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de ltar spyod pa'i tshe chos gang rgyu dang rkyen mang po 'dus pa las skye ba dang / chos gang rgyu dang rkyen mang po 'dus pa las mngon par sgrub par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag kyang rtogs par khong du chud do //
translated: When bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practice in this way, they understand those dharmas that arise from the collection of many causes and conditions, and those dharmas that are accomplished from the collection of many causes and conditions.

original: chos gang rgyu dang rkyen 'dus pa las rnam pa sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid mtshungs par ldan par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag rtogs par khong du chud kyang mngon par zhen pa yang med la /
analyzed: chos gang rgyu dang rkyen 'dus pa las rnam pa sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid mtshungs par ldan par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag rtogs par khong du chud kyang mngon par zhen pa yang med la /
translated: They understand those dharmas that arise from the collection of causes and conditions as having various natures that are in accordance with each other, but they do not generate attachment.

original: chos thams cad ces gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rjes su rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rjes su rtogs par byed do //
translated: They also understand the characteristics of all dharmas as they are taught.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med par yang rab tu rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med par yang rab tu rtogs par byed do //
translated: They understand the presence of signs and the absence of signs.

original: khams rnams kyi bye brag dang / khams sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag kyang rab tu rtogs par 'gyur ro /🔽gang gis rgyu byas nas nyon mongs pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams la @213a *//
analyzed: khams rnams kyi bye brag dang / khams sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag kyang rab tu rtogs par 'gyur ro / gang gis rgyu byas nas nyon mongs pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams la @213a *//
translated: They understand the distinctions among the elements and the distinctions in the nature of the various elements.

original: brten pa dang / gzhol bar mi 'gyur ba yang khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brten pa dang / gzhol bar mi 'gyur ba yang khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: They understand how, having created the cause, they do not rely on or engage with the phenomena of dependent origination that are created by the afflictions.

original: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams phan tshun mi 'gal bar yang rjes su rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams phan tshun mi 'gal bar yang rjes su rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They understand how the mundane and supramundane phenomena are not mutually exclusive.

original: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad dang / 'jig rten pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyag rgya yang yongs su rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad dang / 'jig rten pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyag rgya yang yongs su rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They understand all mundane and supramundane phenomena and the mundane characteristics of phenomena.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs gcig gis kyang chos thams cad kyi rnam grangs khong du chud par byed la /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs gcig gis kyang chos thams cad kyi rnam grangs khong du chud par byed la /
translated: They understand all phenomena through a single Dharma discourse.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs mang pos kyang chos gcig gi rnam grangs khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs mang pos kyang chos gcig gi rnam grangs khong du chud par byed do //
translated: They understand the enumeration of a single phenomenon through many enumerations of phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi rnam grangs kyis kyang chos gcig gi rnam grangs la rten par mi phyed la /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rnam grangs kyis kyang chos gcig gi rnam grangs la rten par mi phyed la /
translated: They do not rely on the enumeration of a single phenomenon through the enumeration of all phenomena.

original: chos gcig gi rnam grangs kyis kyang chos rnams kyi rnam grangs la rten par mi byed do //
analyzed: chos gcig gi rnam grangs kyis kyang chos rnams kyi rnam grangs la rten par mi byed do //
translated: They do not rely on the enumeration of all phenomena through the enumeration of a single phenomenon.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs de lta bu dag ma lus par yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs de lta bu dag ma lus par yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
translated: They completely purify such enumerations of phenomena.

original: blo gros mtha' yas /
analyzed: blo gros mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantamati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang chos 'di nan tan gyis sgrub par byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang chos 'di nan tan gyis sgrub par byed pa de dag ni /
translated: those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice these phenomena

original: tshul gcig pa'i tshig gis bstan pa'i rnam grangs gcig gis chos thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid ro gcig pa khong du chud par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: tshul gcig pa'i tshig gis bstan pa'i rnam grangs gcig gis chos thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid ro gcig pa khong du chud par 'gyur bas /
translated: will understand that all phenomena have a single essence through a single statement that teaches a single principle.

original: chos thams cad la rtsod pa med pa tshul bzhin gyis rab tu dben pa'i mchog thob par 'gyur @213b te; phan tshun 'gal ba med par 'khor mang po'i nang du chos 'di'i bsngags pa brjod nas yang dag par bstan pa dang / nan tan gyis bsgrubs pas chos thams cad kyi rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin kyang rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la rtsod pa med pa tshul bzhin gyis rab tu dben pa'i mchog thob par 'gyur @213b te; phan tshun 'gal ba med par 'khor mang po'i nang du chos 'di'i bsngags pa brjod nas yang dag par bstan pa dang / nan tan gyis bsgrubs pas chos thams cad kyi rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin kyang rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain the samādhi of the ocean mudrā of all phenomena by praising and teaching this Dharma in the midst of the assembly without mutual contradiction, and by practicing it earnestly.

original: de ltar mngon par bsgrubs pas rtsod pa dang / bcas pa dang / rtsod pa med pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: de ltar mngon par bsgrubs pas rtsod pa dang / bcas pa dang / rtsod pa med pa yang rung ste /
translated: By accomplishing it in this way, whether there is dispute or not,

original: de dag thams cad nye bar zhi bar gyur pas tshul bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad nye bar zhi bar gyur pas tshul bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: all of that will be pacified and they will abide properly.

original: nga rgyal dang / bag med pa dag kyang rjes su mthun pas yongs su spong bar byed do //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / bag med pa dag kyang rjes su mthun pas yongs su spong bar byed do //
translated: They will also abandon pride and carelessness in accordance with the Dharma.

original: nges par bshad pa dag kyang legs par yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: nges par bshad pa dag kyang legs par yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
translated: They will also properly uphold the definitive explanations.

original: ming dang / tshig tha dad pa dag kyang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming dang / tshig tha dad pa dag kyang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the different names and words are also completely fulfilled.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul dag la yang thabs mkhas pas nan tan gyis sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul dag la yang thabs mkhas pas nan tan gyis sgrub par byed do //
translated: They also practice with skillful means in the ways of the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi sgo rnams kyang legs par yid la byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi sgo rnams kyang legs par yid la byed do //
translated: They also properly attend to the Dharma gateways.

original: chos gang dang mtshungs par ldan pa'am mtshungs par mi ldan pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: chos gang dang mtshungs par ldan pa'am mtshungs par mi ldan pa yang rung ste /
translated: They are either in accord with or not in accord with any phenomena.

original: thabs mkhas pas nges pa'i don la bsam pa rnam par dag pas rab tu gnas par byed do //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas nges pa'i don la bsam pa rnam par dag pas rab tu gnas par byed do //
translated: With skillful means, they abide with pure intention in the definitive meaning.

original: blo gros mtha' yas /
analyzed: blo gros mtha' yas /
translated: “Anantamati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang chos kyi sgo 'di la de ltar gnas pa de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang chos kyi sgo 'di la de ltar gnas pa de dag ni /
translated: those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who abide in this Dharma gateway

original: spyod pa chung dus chos thams cad kyi rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas chos kyi rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa 'dis @214a *//
analyzed: spyod pa chung dus chos thams cad kyi rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas chos kyi rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa 'dis @214a *//
translated: will attain the samādhi of the ocean mudrā of all phenomena with a small amount of practice. With this samādhi of the ocean mudrā of phenomena, which is immeasurable,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu gzhol bar byed do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu gzhol bar byed do //
translated: and they are dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽Then at that time the Bhagavān spoke these verses:

original: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa; khyed kyis chos rnams thams cad ni //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa; khyed kyis chos rnams thams cad ni //
translated: “You should see that all phenomena

original: chos kyi dbyings su 'jug pa ltos //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su 'jug pa ltos //
translated: enter into the realm of phenomena.

original: chos rnams chos dbyings mtshungs pas ni //
analyzed: chos rnams chos dbyings mtshungs pas ni //
translated: Because phenomena are the same as the realm of phenomena,

original: tshul ni kun kyang mnyam pa yin //
analyzed: tshul ni kun kyang mnyam pa yin //
translated: all the methods are the same.
